answer:
The answer is:

Georges Benjamin Clemenceau was Prime Minister of France during World War I and played a pivotal role in obtaining the Treaty of Saint-Germain-en-Laye. His main speech at the signing ceremony was widely praised as a masterpiece of oratory. In France, he is known for his forceful and uncompromising stance against German hegemony.
